  4440. I have curly hair which gets frizzy when it's dry and after applying this oil it defined my curls and left my hair so soft.

  4446. I believe this is also the real stuff as the consistency, color, and slight odor are the same as the type sold in the aforementioned store.

All Reviews

  1. I love this poduct! I'm actually using a different brand before and when I saw this, thought it's not gonna hurt to try. I used the other brand on the other side of my face and this insta natural on the right side of my face. I am impressed that this one absorbed a lot faster and it doesn't feel oily at all. My husband noticed the changes on my face, my skin looks softer and healthy. I am also using this now too for my body, daily with my fav lotion. It does have a nutty scent. I'm also using this for my baby tortoises, their shells are also healthy, thanks to this! :)
  2. If you're wondering what fresh Argan oil should smell like, this is it. I love the rich, nutty smell, which disappears a few moments after you apply the oil. Definitely the freshest argan oil I've used, (another brand had an 'old' odor and I'm still trying to get a refund on the full bottle I recently bought.<br /><br />Which brings me to another plus of purchasing this oil - Instanatural's amazing customer service. Just read their replies to negative reviews here, and you'll see what I mean. This company will issue a hassle free refund, in case it doesn't work out for you. This is also the largest size of Argan oil I've seen, at the best price I've found.<br /><br />I love using this natural, organic, fresh oil on my skin. It keeps my skin soft and moisturized. I add a big squirt to my body lotion, rubbing my lotion and the oil together in my hands, before applying to my body. Wonderful. Hopefully I'll see more firmness with continued use.<br /><br />After reading the label, which suggests using 1-3 drops on the face, I realize I've been using way too much product. I'm probably using about 12 drops just on my face and neck. But it smells so fresh and natural that I love slathering it on.<br /><br />I don't really have wrinkles, I have fine lines. I've been using this for about 2 weeks so and it seems to soften the fine lines. I'm using this together with the Instanatural Vitamin C serum, which I bought at the same time. I'll try to post a review on the Vitamin C serum after I've used it a bit longer.
  3. I have skin that transitioning from normal to slightly dry. I am still prone to random breakouts, I felt my skin was looking tired and splotchy and so I decided to mix up my routine.<br /><br />This oil has been Wonderful! It is the only moisturizer I use now. I wash my face as usual in the evening using Cetaphil and occasionally adding in some microdermbrasion 'sand' to give my face some exfoliation. I spread a medium weight coat over my skin. It soaks in quickly, When I wash in the morning, I apply with a lighter hand, waiting about 10 minutes before applying makeup. I will also use this to remove eye makeup when I use the waterproof mascara.<br /><br />My skin tone has evened out. The patches of dry are gone, and i have a smooth texture now. I didn't realize that my pores were enlarged, But now they are markedly less noticeable.<br /><br />When my hair seems like it needs some extra moisturizing I will work 4 drops or so through it in the evening, and wash in the morning.<br /><br />I admit I am not fond of the pump, and would prefer the option of selecting a dropper. One hurried morning in a bit of inattention i had the pump facing the wrong way and shot it right on my blouse. Oops. Luckily it cleaned out easily in the wash.

Be careful not tongues it too often. I changed the way I use it though. I part my hair in multiple places and apply a drop or two to each part and rub in gently and throughly. After letting it sit for about 20 min to and hour I take a shower and wash my hair. I wash my hair once every 3 days and that's the only time I apply it. Don't over use this product. Like anything else use it in moderation.

I tried so many things before that. I now have a road map on my forehead from 1st an overdose of thyroid meds & it has only gotten worse with treatment of the Lyme because I can't think clearly so I bought a Derma Roller & use their Viamin C Toner (love the spray bottle), Retinol, Hyaluric Serum, the Argan Oil & then follow with my moisturizer every night. During the day just the Argain Oil on my face & lips but not eyes followed by my moisturizer or my eye makeup slides off. The other company I bought from I sent an email because I ordered 4 different bottles & 1 was missing half the bottom so I had cuts & glass embedded in my fingers. Amazon made it right but they really didn't seem to care which made me not feel confident in their company. I also told them when reading the reviews trying to find one that wasn't, &#34;I received this bottle to review but this is my honest opinion....&#34; was too much. No response! I don't know if I can write the name of the other company but I'm taking a picture of the 2 bottles side by side but just the other turned around. I was sent 4 emails, one for each product I bought from InstaNatural more than once again to follow up! It has really made a difference on my forehead, not over night but slow & steady so I am a customer for life. I wrote them an email telling them all I have written here & they went above & beyond with their customer service. I highly recommend their Argan Oil & all their products. I also use it on on my hair & leave it on over night which is excellent. I have very rough skin on the tips of two finger on both hands so I use it there too & it has pretty much solved that problem. Lastly, I have very dry, flaking & itchy skin, sometimes painful spot on each my cheeks & not the ones on my face either. This has pretty much healed them! I need to see a Dermatologist but I have enough on my plate so this is working so I can't complain. I love this Argan Oil & can't rave enough about it & their customer service. To me that is part of what makes a good company!!! Peace & health to all! 💫

I was going to use this for a face moisturizer before applying my make-up, but I'd likely have to wait a good 10-15 minutes before applying said make-up to let the oil soak in the skin first. I REALLY wanted to like this stuff, for the price point, it's a great deal. I'm debating between ordering another bottle in hopes I got one from a bad/smelly batch or bagging it altogether. Hmmm...<br /><br />UPDATE 6/8/2015:<br />I ended up ordering a second bottle only to have it smell the same. Both bottles had an expiration date of 12/17 on the bottom. I finally called Instanatural directly and told them about the terrible smells of the 2 bottles that I ordered from Amazon, and without any reservation, the representative kindly said that it should not smell so bad (and that they've been in talks with Amazon about how they store the product) and sent me an entirely new bottle FREE OF CHARGE. FANTASTIC customer service! She said that the oil should smell similar to olive oil and not a cow's ass (she didn't say that last part exactly). I did receive that 3rd bottle a couple days ago, and in does in fact smell the same. Wah wah. However, I try now to place the smell in an olive category instead of a farm animal category and that helps my nose bare it a bit more. It still smells yucky, but I can take it now knowing that it's just the smell of the regular product and not from a bad/old bottle. 4 stars.

Like I said, the water here just turns you into a raisin and I've tried all kinds of lotions.   328. This is a lightweight oil that has done wonders for my cuticles that typically get cracked and very dry during the winter months. Applying just a tiny amount of this Argan Oil twice a day (morning and night) directly on my cuticles has really improved their condition. Not only that but the skin on my hands is smoother. I usually drop a few drops on the palm of one hand then with dip the cuticles of each finger on the other hand into the palm. After that I rub the coated cuticles on the other hands' cuticles. Rub the oil into the cuticles with my fingers then just rub my hands all over to distribute the leftover oil on my hands. It's not exactly like a hand cream... it won't moisturize quite like a thick gooey hand cream but it does soften the skin.<br /><br />I've also used a small amount of this on my hair... just 4-6 drops rubbed on my palms than run through my hair. Gives my hair a slight sheen but more than that it reduces the frizzies.<br /><br />It's got an earthy, nutty smell... no surprise there because it's made from nuts.<br /><br />This is Organic and pure. Very few frizzies...so silky and soft and manageable. It was truly like straw before I started using this on a routine basis. I love the dropper--it's essential for portioning out the oil. The dropper is rather drippy, so I squirt all but a scant amount out so I don't drip it all over the sink as I'm transferring it to my hand (I tried another brand of argan oil without any dosing mechanism and I always used way too much and looked like I had a Jheri Curl!). A little bit will go a long way and it'll last forever. Totally recommend this.

  394. I have to say that I have gotten several products by this company, and without fail they are excellent quality and do what they say. This one is no exception. It definitely made my skin very smooth, and my hair shiny and in good repair. My only complaint is a minor one: I am now used to being impressed by how good the vendor's products smell, and this is the exception in that regard alone. However, this product IS exactly what it says: 100% argan oil. Not all oil smells good; this doesn't smell horrid, just not lovely (and who doesn't like to smell lovely before bed? :). It is still worth getting, but you might keep in mind that you'll want to follow it with something pleasantly-scented if you'll be in close contact shortly thereafter. Thanks for asking me to review this - I had heard good things, and you did not disappoint! If you have recommendations for what to use to scent this (like maybe a drop or two of lavender-scented oil?), please feel free to share!

  416. I'm a naturalista in many ways, so of course I pounced on this exciting 100% natural product & couldn't wait to try it out for myself. What is it you ask? InstaNatural's 100% Pure Organic Argan Oil of course. First off, I absolutely love the cobalt blue bottle, it caught my eye and drew me in.. I unscrewed the top to find a dropper.. like an eyedropper, only bigger, and full of the nectar of the gods.<br /><br />My hair is natural and my wavy locks have enjoyed the nourishment of this product for a month now. A little pure organic oil goes a long way. I drop about 4 or 5 drops into my palms, rub my hands together gently and attack my tresses. I work the oil into my scalp and massage it into the strands, and the ends of my hair. I have used the oil after a fresh wash, before a blow dry and on an average day just for moisture. My hair is softer, more manageable, and shines like a polished diamond. I was reluctant to use the oil on my skin, but I tried it, and raved at the way this liquid silk immersed my skin. What is Organic Argan Oil? Well it's equivalent to Moroccan/Liquid Gold. Argan Oil is pressed from the fruits of the Argan Tree[Argania Spinosa], a tree that is native to Morocco and can live up to 200 years. There are many uses for this unbelievable product, I will name just a few of my favorites:<br />•As a face moisturizer-After cleansing, massage a few drops on face/neck [Argan is considered a dry oil, and is never sticky or greasy, it absorbs immediately into your skin]<br />•Leave-in conditioner-While hair is still damp, add a few drops to your hair and scalp, to hydrate and moisturize [don't forget to use the oil on dry hair too, before blow drying, it works wonders]<br />•Cuticle & Heel softener-Massage into cuticles to soften and promote nail growth, generously moisturize feet, pull on a pair of socks overnight, to replenish dry, cracked heels<br />•As a bath oil- Drop just a bit into your warm bath for smooth and supple, re-hydrated skin results<br /><br />I love how raw and natural this product is. There are no harsh chemicals or preservatives to complicate things. I have enjoyed using this product from head to toe, and have added it to my daily beauty regimen.s<br /><br />I love how raw and natural this product is. There are no harsh chemicals or preservatives to complicate things. I have enjoyed using this product from head to toe, and have added it to my daily beauty regimen.

  419. For real, I love this product. I read lots of things about how the really good Argan Oil isn't going to be cheap, yaddah yaddah, so I must admit, I was a little skeptical about Insta Natural's great price. I purchased my bottle in the winter, specifically to use on my face, as I was putting my skin through the ringer that season - hot and dry indoors to cold and windy outdoors. Honestly, I wasn't sure how I felt about it for the first week or so. Lots of people said to only use a little, but I was convinced they didn't know my life, so I slathered my face with the oil (to heal it from the nasty cold wind, of course). Yeah, not a great idea. Because seriously, you only need a little bit of this stuff. I think the reason I was getting such mixed results at first was because I was convinced I needed to use a whole bunch. Once I began limiting myself to three pumps TOPS, I was hooked. I have been using three pumps on my face every night before bed. It does take a little bit of time for it to soak in, but I think this has more to do with my using three pumps than anything else. I could lessen the amount used to have it soak in faster, but I don't mind going to sleep with a slightly oily face when I know I'll be waking up to smooth, soft skin. I also apply just a tiny (TINY) bit in the morning before putting on my makeup, and that seems to soak right up. I've been using the same bottle for five months and am only just now reaching the final ounces. My complexion has cleared up. My eyelashes are longer (which just sort of happened as a byproduct), and I could not be happier. The customer service at Insta Natural was great too! When they reached out, asking me to write a review, and I mentioned not being sure how I felt about the product yet, they went above and beyond to ensure I was being taken care of. They truly believe in their product, and frankly, I do too. :)

One evening while watching TV, I put a few drops of the oil onto my heel and massaged them in for a few minutes. Then I repeated this on my other heel. Honestly, I wasn't expecting a lot. I did notice that the oil absorbed quickly, with no strange odors or lingering oiliness on my fingers. A few nights later, I pulled out the bottle again to repeat the process. And I noticed -- much to my surprise -- that my heels looked better. The lines didn't appear white anymore, and they were less visible. Additionally, my heels felt smooth on the couch, and not in danger of &#34;catching&#34; on the threads in that dry, icky way.   549. I am genuinely impressed with InstaNatural's Organic Argan Oil. I had tried a few organic fair-trade argan oils before and they always made me break out. And let me say that I am supremely pleased that I did! I typically alternate between organic cold-pressed coconut oil, rosehip seed oil, grapeseed, and evening primrose oil as a counteractive measure since my skin starts to revolt when I regularly use the same type of oil for an extended period. I have been using this argan oil consistently since I first ordered it a few weeks ago and I've yet to experience any adverse effects.<br /><br />With regards to usage, a few drops really do go a long way and I always recommend that a hydrosol be misted over the face prior to moisturising. If the price seems a bit high, just know that you'd be hard-pressed to find the more 'exotic' oils in such a large bottle at a fair price unless purchasing in bulk and not everyone has the time, money, or storage for that. Organic cold-pressed oils are never going to be cheap, at least not if you want them to be pure and ethically-sourced. One does pay a premium for quality and in this instance, I'm glad to say it was justified. That said, it was still cheaper than the other argan products I had previously purchased.<br /><br />The oil comes in a cobalt glass bottle with a long glass dropper which makes application very convenient. It has a delicately sweet scent that is quite pleasant (to me anyway) and I take issue with the reviewer who claimed this was adulterated in some way. While I am hardly an expert on all the organic argan oils of the world (well, really Morocco), being an avid cook, I'm pretty sure I know what olive oil smells like (and on that fragrance note, olive oil itself is often a counterfeit mixture of canola and chlorophyll; seriously, Google it). Fact of the matter is, none of the previous argan oils I had tried smelled this good.<br /><br />I also appreciated that the seller made a sincere effort to follow up on my order. It's not often one sees that kind of commitment to customer satisfaction. I look forward to making the InstaNatural line a staple of my beauty arsenal.I'm pretty sure I know what olive oil smells like (and on that fragrance note, olive oil itself is often a counterfeit mixture of canola and chlorophyll; seriously, Google it).   559. This is a nice, big glass bottle, tinted blue (argan oil needs to be in a dark bottle to retain its properties). It's high quality USDA certified organic argan oil, and it feels and works great. I use three or four drops on my face at night after my cleansing and vitamin C/HCA routine. I worried at first that my pillowcase would get oily, but it doesn't. The argan oil sinks in quickly and doesn't rub off. It doesn't stay oily at all, and the mild scent goes away once it's dry.<br /><br />It's also very nice on hands and hair, whether you just use a few drops in damp hair or mix it into your conditioner.   597. I received a bottle of argan oil for the purposes of review. All opinions are my own.<br />I had the opportunity to sample some Insta Natural 100% Pure Argan Oil. So what makes this product special? Well it’s more of what is NOT in the bottle. If you read the ingredients, you will only see one ingredient. Argan oil. That’s it. This is the real thing, harvested from the argan tree in Morocco. Every bottle of Insta Natural Argan Oil is certified organic. It preservative free, and also fragrance free. This is a product which is a great option for people with allergies or chemical sensitivities.<br /><br />I used this product for a period of two weeks. After showering and towel drying my hair, I dispensed a few drops of Insta Natural Argan Oil into my palms, rubbed the oil vigorously between my hands and applied it to the ends of my hair where it tends to be the driest and most damaged.<br /><br />The temptation when using a product like this is always to use a little more than the label recommends. However, I can assure you that you DO NOT want to apply too much of this product. When they say 100% pure, they really mean it. If you use more than a few drops, then your hair will appear oily and limp. A little (really little) bit goes a long way, and that’s the truth. A handful of drops (5-7) is what I needed to make my shoulder length hair look soft and manageable.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this product. It was very moisturizing, to both the hair and the scalp. It is also a great tonic for dried cuticles, as I have only recently learned. If you are going to invest in a good quality argan oil, then you will not be steered wrong with this product. Insta Natural offers a 100% guarantee on their product. If you are not satisfied, then you will receive your money back, no questions asked.

(I suppose a lot of people would find it unpleasant, but I really like it!) Being that it's 100% pure argan oil, I was please to see that it's true and nothing has been added to this product. Thus far, I've only used this product as a moisturizer for my hands and nails, but my plan is to eventually treat my hair with it. I have quite dry and damaged hair that could really benefit for argan oil, or so I've heard.<br /><br />As for using it on my hands and nails, I like it as I would any other. It seems to do a good job of moisturizing my hands (which get cracked). As it's an oil, it doesn't take much to go a pretty long way. A couple drops does just fine for my hands.<br /><br />Read the full review on: maegal . blogspot . com

  639. The oil comes in a four ounce dark glass bottle with a dropper attached inside the screw-on cap. I really love this packaging since it's practical and sturdy. The dropper lets you dispense the product a few drops at a time, which is perfect, since a little goes a long way. It's a myth that you can only use oils on very dry skin; as long as you're only using a few drops, this oil will work well even on combo skin like mine and won't turn you greasy or make you break out.<br /><br />The argan oil has a light amber color and a very faint nutty scent. This works great for moisturizing the cuticles or for softening dry, rough patches of skin. It's a slightly &#34;dry&#34; oil, so it doesn't leave the skin feeling super-slick. I also like using it on the ends of my hair, before applying a leave-in conditioner, to help tame any split ends or roughness. If you want a good makeup remover that won't stink, sting or dry out the skin, try a few drops of this on a cotton pad before washing the face as usual. (Be careful around the eyes--anything stings once it's in the eyes, natural or not.)<br /><br />I love that this replaces a host of other less green products--hair masks, cuticle oils, etc.--and it's a great price per ounce.

  688. For years I have had perpetual acne on my chin. The hard, cystic kind. I never had acne as a teenage and it seemed so unfair to be fighting wrinkles and pimples at the same time. Anyway, I have tried oral antibiotics (doxycycline and erythromycin) which helped some but have side effects. I've had chemical peels and laser treatments. I have had some success with a Burt's Bee's acne product, too. But NOTHING made it go completely away.<br /><br />I was ready to start Accutane. For those of you unfamiliar with what that entails, let me tell you: monthly Dermatologist visits, monthly blood work, proof of 2 forms of birth control (despite being over forty, married, and husband having vasectomy), and THOUSANDS of dollars.<br /><br />I postponed my Derm appointment and gave this product a try after seeing something on Pinterest. It is WONDERFUL. My skin has not looked this good for years. I am so happy. I am also much better off financially and have more free time b/c I am not running to the Dermatologist every month.<br /><br />It is a little greasy as you might guess. It is, after all, an oil. However, it is not as greasy as you'd think. If I have plenty of time before I am going out, I can actually wear this before applying makeup. If I am in a hurry and need to rush out, I skip it until end of day. But, it soaks in faster than you'd think. It leaves your skin as soft as a baby's bottom.<br /><br />I am not sure what to say about its effect on wrinkles but I do think my skin looks &#34;plumper&#34;. The turgor and texture are definitely better. If you are looking for something to change fine lines... I can't comment on this b/c I haven't really paid attention to this feature.<br /><br />Also, I don't use this on my hair, but I suspect it is great for hair. I think this b/c of a little unpleasant (but acceptable) side effect from daily use. I've notice that my facial hair seems to be growing faster. I am blonde and what I am talking about is that soft, fine, almost translucent facial hair that you get. Not like a burly mustache or anything. I used get a facial threading about every 3-4 months (maybe less frequent...) and it seems like I want to get it done more frequently now. Which recently led me to increase use of the product around my sparse eyebrows. We'll see if it helps. But, if you are hoping to thicken your hair, this may help.<br /><br />At this price for a product that will last at least 2 months if used properly, it is worth a try if you are suffering from acne.

It's been a few weeks since I have received my order and I am very happy to report that I am loving it!<br /><br />At first glance / feel, I was apprehensive to apply it my face as it is somewhat thick and oily. Based on the two drops in the palm of my hand, I thought to myself that there was no way I was going to put that on my face as I would look like an oily mess. That said, I'm always up for a challenge, so I rubbed my hands together and applied the oil to my face. My immediate reaction was to say out loud, &#34;No way! Not for me.&#34; It felt way too heavy and oily to be used a facial moisturizer and I figured I'd return it.<br /><br />However, about five to ten minutes later, it had completely absorbed into my skin and I couldn't even tell that I had put anything on my face.   724. Argan oil is extracted form the kernel that comes from the Argan tree that is found in Morocco. It has so many benefits in it's natural form for the body to even using it in foods. I have used Argan oil for many years now for my hair because I use a Keratin process to straighten it. I have thick long Latina hair and I avoid using products that weigh my hair down making it look greasy, stiff or dull.<br /><br />My hair goes through a lot - from chemical straightening, to coloring and high temperature appliances such as blow dryers and flat irons. Argan oil protects my hair before using heating appliances and then locks in the look after. Rich in Omega 3 and 9 which helps to prevent hair loss and repairs damaged hair follicles. Absorbs quickly into your hair without weighing it down.<br /><br />Apply to wet hair just before blow drying to eliminate friction and prevent hair breakage, or apply to curly hair to give it a polished look that will last all day long. Protects, adds moisture and shine...naturally.<br /><br />I was pretty impressed on the size of this bottle, it is quite large for the asking price. It comes with an eye dropper which is a nice touch since most other brands you have to pour it out and you tend to pour out too much.<br /><br />Another great comment I must mention is that the odor disappears after a few minutes of application. I don't understand how but I love it! This is 100% Argan oil with no perfumes. If you know your Argan oil you know they are not pleasant smelling unless the have perfumes added. However, after rubbing this into my hair, the odor &#34;magically&#34; disappears and I am felt with no harsh smelling scent.<br /><br />No matter if your hair is thick, dry, frizzy, thick, curly, or just out of control - Argan oil will help. Do some online searches for the many uses of Argan oil. Besides using it &#34;as is&#34; from the bottle, you can use it as a hot oil treatment, skin moisturizer, dry scalp and eczema treatment, treat dry hands and cuticles, treats mild acne since it has Oleic acid, use it to grill vegetables, add some lemon and use as salad dressing. I'm sometimes doubtful of the purity of<br />Argan oils because it is too easy to buy &#34;pure&#34; and have it turn out to be a blend. It is also certified organic by<br />Ecocert.<br /><br />I like the pump bottle that InstaNatural packages their argan oil in. Its really easy to use and you don't get too<br />much or too little with one pump. The bottle is decent sized, but doesn't cost an arm and a leg. It will last a<br />while and won't be expensive to replace when you run out. This argan oil doesn't have any added scents or other<br />oils, so it looks and smells exactly as it should. No surprises. I'd definitely recommend this product.<br /><br />Argan oil has so many great uses, it is pretty much an all-purpose oil. I have really damaged hair because I dye my<br />hair neon red, so I use this to help with the damage, split ends, and frizz. I've also used argan oil on my nails<br />and skin. There's a reason why argan oil is referred to as &#34;liquid gold&#34;. It has so many different uses! You can<br />use it for acne, as a moisturizer, as a toner, as an aftershave, as a conditioner, shiny hair, glowing skin, cuticle/heel softener, nail<br />strengthener, bath oil, body oil, and so many more things!<br /><br />This product was provided to me for testing and review purposes, but I would never endorse something that I didn't believe was worthy of it and I would never post an opinion that wasn't my own.

  813. I just recently started using Argan oil for treating my dry/cracked hands due to winter. It’s been hugely helpful – not only does it help soothe the dryness, it does an excellent job of helping heal the cracks at my fingertips. Absolutely wonderful stuff.<br /><br />This brand of Argan oil is priced less than the oil I've been using, but there’s zero difference. It offers the same benefits, there is no odor to the oil (other than the usual small “earthy” scent that is typical of Argan oil) and it comes nicely packaged in a very attractive cobalt blue glass bottle with a dropper. While it does not have the “gift box” packaging other Argan oils have, it also does not have the same price.<br /><br />The oil is imported from Morocco and bottled in the US. According to the label it is USDA certified organic and has not been tested on animals.<br /><br />You need very little to get results. I use a drop or two per hand and that is plenty. A 4 oz bottle such as this will last a LONG time!<br /><br />As with any oil product, it feels oily when it is first applied. But, after a few minutes, the oil sheen dissipates and the oil is absorbed. I have not noticed any greasy residue after using it on my hands and fingertips.<br /><br />Excellent quality Argan oil at a good price. Highly recommend.<br />[Sample provided for review]

Argan oil is a hot product right now in the cosmetics market, and you can find it in shampoos and premium lotions nowadays, and it’s always pretty expensive due to the extensive labor used to extract it.<br /><br />The quality of this argan oil is superb–it’s cold-pressed to maintain its vitamins, and it’s also certified organic, so I’d assume that’s a good thing as well. You get a large 4oz bottle of pure argan oil for a decent price, so I’d definitely recommend this product if you’re looking for argan oil for your skin or looking to try something new (this was new for me!), then give this a try.   1019. I've never purchased or used argan oil before cause I could never bring myself to pay the high prices I've seen for it. But my sister has been using it for years and so I've both smelled and seen it. So let's start with what I already know.<br /><br />1. Real pure argan oil is a clear golden colour, with the texture you're expecting from an oil. This is golden, but very thick, almost viscose and cloudy.<br /><br />2. Argan oil has a faintly nutty, though not unpleasant scent. Another reviewer stated that this one smelled like vomit, and I figured, hyperbole. Nope, I promise you, this smells like straight up, throwup. Made my stomach turn and I almost lost my dinner.<br /><br />Now, why did I finally take the plunge and purchase this when I was so reluctant in the past? I didn't. This is my fourth product from this company. The first three they sent me for blog review purposes gave me the worst reactions to skincare that I've had in a long time, and ever really from a &#34;natural&#34; brand. I'm talking a burning, itching face and swollen eyes. When I contacted them and let them know this, they offered me this product for my sensitive skin. I told them sure why not.<br /><br />I won't be using this, it's going straight in the bin. From a company that I was already a bit leery of, to get something that is almost the polar opposite of the product it purports to be, makes me highly suspicious, and I won't take chances with either my skin or hair.<br /><br />They may not be a sham, but I don't trust their products, and something is most definitely fishy about their product line.

  1030. Argan oil is produced from the kernels of the argan tree (argania spinosa) and is found exclusively in morocco. It is the rarest and most expensive oil on earth and is used mainly to moisturise hair, skin, nails, face and body.<br /><br />Received for review the product is presented in a 120mL brown glass bottle and comes with a capped pump action spray. It is colourless, relatively runny and has a pleasant mild nutty odour. It is very fast absorbing and leaves a thin shiny layer of oil on your skin after it has been applied.<br /><br />Application of the product is done differently for each body region, however in general it involves using only 1-3 drops per application and it is likely to be more effective if used every 1-2 days:<br /><br />Hair-<br />Apply 1-3 drops to the scalp or hair of washed hair and massage the oil in gently. Leave on hair for 30 mins.<br /><br />Skin-<br />Apply 1-3 drops to a washed face and massage into skin in a circular motion. Leave to dry for 3-5 mins and add makeup (if required).<br /><br />Nails-<br />Apply 1-3 drops around cuticles and fingertips and leave to absorb naturally.<br /><br />After using the product for several days I found that it made my hair, skin and nails shinier and covered up my scars and skin imperfections very well with a thin layer of oil. My skin looked hydrated and healthy without feeling greasy. I have not been using it for long enough to see what it can do with continued use however I will document my findings in this review over time.<br /><br />The product also has the benefits of being organic and extremely concentrated which means that it's much healthier for your body and is likely to last a lot longer than other products which may need to be used in much larger amounts.<br /><br />Verdict: Rarest and most expensive oil on earth.

  1167. Thanks to the generosity of the supplier, we have had the opportunity to test this excellent product. We’ve used argan oil indirectly as a minor constituent of massage oil so I was interested to try the pure product.<br /><br />I’ve been using it for a few weeks as a replacement for the hand cream I usually use and am very impressed. It takes a little while to absorb but thereafter feels nice for ages and leaves a pleasant, slightly nutty aroma. Being a roofer’s labourer and out in all weathers, my hands have a hard life and I’ve noticed that cuts and scratches seem to heal more rapidly since I’ve been using the oil. I can’t really comment on the condition of my nails as they’re so hard anyway but I have noticed that the irritating hard skin that accumulates at the edges of the nails is softer and not snaggly (so that thankfully I don’t have the urge to nibble it). I also use it as a post-shaving moisturiser in place of my regular one and I actually prefer it and, in the interest of experimentation, have also been rubbing a drop into my scalp after showering (I have very short hair) and have noticed none of my usual itchiness or slight dandruff. I should point out that my skin is naturally dry so I don’t know how good it would be on an oilier complexion.<br /><br />My wife has been using it as a substitute for her usual post-shower body moisturiser and is perfectly happy with the results and she also seems satisfied with it as a pre-wash hair conditioner, where just a couple of drops massaged into her hair and left for 15 mins. or so before shower time seems to result in shinier, somehow bouncier hair.<br /><br />As so little is used each time thanks to the neat pump dispenser, even after weeks of testing, the 120ml bottle is still ¾ full so it will last for ages. I’m so impressed that I may well buy some more when it eventually runs out rather than buying a non-organic equivalent; given that the product is absorbed into the skin, it makes sense to avoid absorbing pesticides at the same time.<br /><br />Not only does it appear that argan oil is a bit of a dermatological cure-all, it is one of the most environmentally friendly products around and is a very important export for Morocco. Much like Portuguese cork oak, it is a totally sustainable & an economically important product providing much needed employment, particularly amongst Moroccan women where co-operatives plough the profits into education for the workers and their children.to avoid absorbing pesticides at the same time.<br /><br />Not only does it appear that argan oil is a bit of a dermatological cure-all, it is one of the most environmentally friendly products around and is a very important export for Morocco. Much like Portuguese cork oak, it is a totally sustainable & an economically important product providing much needed employment, particularly amongst Moroccan women where co-operatives plough the profits into education for the workers and their children.

  1240. I was contacted by InstaNatural to try out some of their natural beauty products. Once I saw what they offered I jumped at the chance to try their items out. The first one I have tried out is the InstaNatural's 100% Pure Argan Oil.<br /><br /> Argan oil is a type of plant oil that is produced from the kernels of the Argan tree that is native in Morocco. Natural Argan oil has a raw, green and nutty aroma, but what is so great about this type of oil is that the scent disappears minutes after being on your skin as true Argan oil absorbs very quickly and without that greasy feeling.<br /><br /> InstaNatural strive to have their customers 100% satisfied. Their logo is actually &#34;we truly care about you&#34;. The Argan Oil comes in a 4 fl. oz (120 mL) glass bottle with a long dropper. Trust me while experimenting with this a little goes a long way. InstaNatural's 100% Pure Argan Oil is so natural that the only ingredient is : 100% pure and certified organic virgin cold-pressed argan oil (Argania Spinosa). There are no chemicals or preservatives added, they do not test on animals and they even offer a 100% money back guarantee if you are not satisfied with the product.<br /><br /> The InstaNatural 100% Pure Argan Oil is a multipurpose oil. This is mainly used cosmetically but can be consumed. For cosmetic uses you can use it as a leave-in conditioner, frizz remover, moisturizer, lip exfoliator and softener, hair/scalp treatment, face mask and nail care.<br /><br />All directions for different uses such as those are on the bottle in pretty large print (at lease as large as you can on a bottle) and are easy to see and use. This is great for any dry, brittle hair.<br /><br /> Acne+ anti-aging: It's great for acne. Use of a face oil helps prevent acne breakouts by preventing irritation and balancing moisture production so you skin does not overproduce on oil. You need a natural non-comodegenic oil, and argan oil is perfect for that. Additives irritate acne so this is perfect - rub a few drops over fingertips and massage into face. Or add some to your daily moisturizing cream. It also has natural anti-aging properties - the Moroccan peasant women use it as such. Again, preservatives age skin, so argan oil is a perfect all-natural solution, and the price is a lot lower than high end anti-aging products that are often less effective. Since it's a rare product that's good for both, it's the perfect solution for older people with acne-prone skin.<br /><br />I rubbed it into my calluses as well and it relieved the burning.   1253. My case is an odd one.<br />I have a skin condition called verrucous dermal nevus. It's not severe at all (so if you're brave to search for images of it, that's not what my skin looks like... Also, don't search for images, it's not great). In any case, it's basically spotty areas somewhere in your body that can get bumpy and dry, and when they really feel like acting up they'll throw in some itching sensation. It's more cosmetic than anything, but the itching can be a bummer sometimes.<br /><br />I've tried several methods to keep this under control, including glycolic acid peels performed by my dermatologist on a regular basis. This proved expensive and painful, since I was basically burning off the top layer of skin off my body every couple of months.<br /><br />I don't know where I read about argan oil, but I do know it was in one of the many websites about dermatological conditions that spoke about VDN. I decided to give it a try, since the worst thing that could happen is I lose those $15.<br /><br />I had low expectations, since pretty much everything I've tried that claims to make skin better is simply not formulated for something like VDN. My conclusion after about two months of use is that I'm very pleasantly impressed with this oil. No, it won't make my condition go away, and it's unrealistic to assume a natural oil will make a genetic condition go away. However, the condition has subsided greatly since I started using argan oil, which I mix with an odorless body lotion (it claims to be the &#34;ultra healing&#34; type), mostly to be able to spread the oil more evenly.<br /><br />Like other reviewers have noted, it does smell badly at first, kind of like mulch which is not an attractive smell. But, the smell does go away quickly and it's nothing that a little bit of cologne or perfume won't take care of anyway. Besides, the results do speak for themselves. Whereas before my skin had large areas of uneven coloring and bumpy textures, the most I have now aresome spots that resemble freckles more than anything. It's definitely enough to make me feel more comfortable in my own skin (that's a pun I fully intended to make) when going to a pool, or the beach.<br /><br />So if you happen to be in the 1/1,000 of people that have this specific and annoying condition, all I can say is it helped me, and it might help you too.

  1268. Great value. I think most of the negative comments in regards of the product leaving hair too oily come from 1st-time buyers who might not know how to use argan oil. Quick tip: just put 2 drops max in your palm, rub hands together a few seconds to warm it up, apply only to ends and sparingly mid-length (wet hair or dry) I got long thick hair and this does the trick. Rub the rest on face, neck or hands. A little goes a looong way. Only complain: wish the bottle was plastic istead of glass. This vendor's oil is high grade. Get it :)

I can't stand flowery scents.<br />The product does contain traces of tree nuts, so be aware in case of allergies or hypersensitivity. Saying that I have very sensitive skin and many allergies, and yet I had no reaction to this at all. Perhaps I used too much or it should be applied to wet hair (only tried it once to mostly dry hair), so this is worth another try.<br /><br />I saw a reviewer's comment stating that this oil mixes with water, so I tried it and NO, it definitely does not mix with water. It repels water. It is OIL. Another reviewer said this oil is \\"clear\\", when real argan oil has a yellowish or golden cast to it. This oil looks clear when it's one drop on your skin, but if you put some into another small bottle as I did for travel purposes, it is definitely yellowish-gold in color.<br /><br />Yes, it has a strange smell to it, but this is consistent with what I've read about real argan oil. The smell is very mild and is either not lasting or not strong enough to make my skin smell this way when I use it. The bottle is a good size and lasts a long time when used only under eyes and on neck (i.e. requires approx. 1/2 a drop for under my eyes), although it obviously goes more quickly when also used on arms & legs.

  1392. I was offered a review bottle of Argan Oil and figured I had nothing to lose by trying it so I accepted the bottle. I opted to try this on my fingernails. I have trouble growing my fingernails out because they often chip, break or split. I have ridges in couple of my nails that run vertically through the nail causing them to crack when they grow longer. They are usually weak and bend and break easily. Honestly I can't believe how strong and healthy my nails have become in 3 weeks. My nails feel like they have several coats of miracle nail on them. They have grown out long and none of them have cracked or chipped. I'm skeptical on the claims of a lot of products. It's often hard to tell if a product has actually worked but there is no doubt that using Argan Oil on my nails has made a difference. My nails never grow this long without applying multiple coats of a nail hardening product. I have used miracle nail in the past and achieved a similar result but this is so much better because I don't have a coating on my nails that will peal off and chip away. My nails are actually strong and healthy with nothing on them.<br /><br />The instructions say to use 1-3 drops around cuticles and fingertips. I used more than that. I have been putting 8-10 drops in the palm of my hand and then thoroughly coating my fingernails and cuticles. I then rub off the excess on my face or legs until my hands don't feel greasy.<br /><br />The smell of this product is something I've grown used to. The first time I applied it I didn't love the smell Over the past three weeks the smell has become &#34;neutral&#34; to me.<br /><br />If you are looking for a product to strengthen your nails this worked for me. It can be used on hair and skin as well. There is a warning on the label that it contains tree nuts so if you have an allergy to tree nuts this isn't for you.<br /><br />You can see a picture of my nails here:<br />http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo18QT9GVP7CK41/B00H93NJLS/B00H93NJLS

  1411. I have been using Organic Argan Oil for several years for various purposes. I use it on my skin, especially my face after cleansing, for a smooth glowing complexion. Argan oil is all I need.<br />I also use it to get soft shiny hair. I simply apply a very small amount on my palm and massage it sparingly right onto my scalp and extend it throughout the hair to the ends. (You don't have to use a lot because it goes a long way. The first time I did it I used too much and my hair turned out very limp because it was weighted down.) I then gather it and put a plastic processing cap over my hair for at least an hour or two, shampoo and condition. The result is a luxurious head of healthy looking hair. I don't have as much breakage since I've begun using this method. It really works!

  1426. Now, many people say this stuff is amazing/clears acne/heals scars/raises your grandmother back from the dead.This is the REAL stuff...now whether it works 'wonders' for you, or just suffices as a moisturizer, may be up to your individually. Argan oil is supposed to be non-comedogenic (not supposed to clog your pores), so supposedly is unlikely to cause a breakout or clog pores. From my own experience, it has not caused any breakouts (I've had quite a while of use--by a different brand at first, bought at Whole Foods for quite a bit more money). I believe this is also the real stuff as the consistency, color, and slight odor are the same as the type sold in the aforementioned store. It has a slight odor--not 'fishy', not unless you've had some strange experiences with cod liver oil, though.<br />As for its supposed miracles... one can often read that this is practically magic, like 'women of Morocco use it'. Careful with statements like that--are the women of Morocco the most beautiful in the world with perfect skin? That has about as much meaning as saying 'women of the U.S. use it', and telling you to buy foot cream. FYI, not hating on Moroccan women--just giving an example. Just because supposedly another nation may traditionally use a specific product doesn't mean that product is the very best of the best.<br />For me, it's been decent...nothing too special. It does moisturize my face, but leaves it looking OILY, so I put it on at night after a face wash, and in the morning first thing out of the shower (quite a bit before putting on make-up). And I do NOT have oily skin--it is sensitive, but normal (neither dry, nor oily, nor with a t-spot). Great at night after washing the face...great as a make-up remover that can get that eye makeup off without hurting those with sensitive skin. Removes super long-lasting lipsticks easily. Leaves lips moisturized. However, you know what else can do that? More than a few other oils. Sweet almond oil has a slightly higher possibility of clogged pores than Argan oil, however I've used that as well (for about ten bucks for eight ounces). Then there's more expensive stuff, etc, etc. About using it on nails/hair/etc... you get the result of a good oil; you do not get access to the fountain of life and your choice of princess crown.<br />BOTTOM LINE: Buy the stuff if the Amazon price is within your price point and you want to try it; at this price, the 4oz makes as much sense as a small portion (especially since you can also use it as a body oil, etc). If you don't like it on your face, and it doesn't perform magic tricks for your nails or hair, at least it's a good body oil that you can use up.
  1427. Organic Argan Oil is very good for the hair,skin and nails.
  1428. I love this oil for my long blonde locks. I apply it to my hands and drag my fingers through the last 6-8 inches while my hair is still damp. I decided to give Argan oil a try since it is a very popular oil and I am so glad that I did. I have curly hair which gets frizzy when it's dry and after applying this oil it defined my curls and left my hair so soft. I don't wash my hair every day and by the second and third day my hair gets super tangled and frizzy but with this oil after the third day my curls are still defined and soft with minor frizz. Obviously I still have split ends but it seems this oil stops my dry ends from getting worse which gives me more time to grow out my hair and not get it trimmed every few months. The way I use this oil is I towel dry my wet hair after I wash it then I apply a generous amount from the ends to the middle top and I rub it in for it to absorb better then apply the remainder to the rest of my hair and brush it out. I love it and would recommend it to others.

I'd underscore the 3 pumps as directed on the bottle because the oil can roll off your hands and get onto carpet. (I just realized some discoloration on the carpet was caused by oil, so I went at the marks with make up remover wipes, which cleared it out.)<br /><br />Effects are satisfactory so far! My acne is healing and diminishing after about 10 days' use and this oil does not seem to trigger eczema. (Some reviews talked about adverse reactions and I can only surmise that everyone is different in the way of sensitivities and allergies.)<br /><br />I was skeptical about this product at first because the description read like a panacea which is just not existent. My dermatologist wasn't even aware of argan oil. Nevertheless, I was pretty desperate to get off of the steroid creams and antibiotics that my dermatologist prescribed.   1495. I wish we had known about Argan oil when I was younger. There are so many uses for it. One of my favorites is for my hair. I take a shower and wash my hair, then wrap my hair in a towel. After a few minutes I take the towel off and brush my hair. Then I take some Argan oil just a couple drops and put in my hands. I rub my hands together then apply to the middle of my hair down to the ends. I don't put it on the top of my hair. It really helps my frizzies to calm down. My hair shines afterwards too.<br /><br />Next I use it as a moisturizer on my face. I wash my face then apply a couple drops, rub in my hands and apply to my face.   1500. Okay, I must have gotten a bad batch of this or something. It smells!! It says that argan oil should smell nutty... this smells like diarrhea. No joke. I looked up signs of 'bad argan oil' and a really terrible smell is most likely due to the oil going rancid from being exposed to too much oxygen. Which actually makes sense because when this came in the mail it leaked everywhere. I lost probably about 2 to 3 tablespoons of product to the box that held it. Anyway... not really impressed with this 'liquid gold'. UPDATE: Costumer service contacted me almost immediately and offered to buy me a new bottle with 2-day shipping, since my first bottle was damaged. I got my second bottle today with no packaging issues :) unfortunately it still smells pretty awful but after reading some of the other reviews, I've found out that that's pretty normal and actually means that it's fresh (?). Overall a pretty good product.

  1511. There are an overwhelming selection of products available for skin care, therefore it can be very difficult to know which products are best if you want healthy, glowing skin. Two products which are currently gaining favor among natural skin care enthusiasts are rosehip oil and argan oil. The nuts of the argan tree are predominantly harvested in Morocco. Although argan oil is a relatively new and unfamiliar beauty product in the United States, it has actually been a skin care staple for many generations of Mediterranean women.<br />As many people will know, rosehips are small fruits produced by a certain type of rose. Like argan oil, rosehip is very high in essential fatty acids. These have two benefits when applied to the skin.
  1512. I saw instant results after using this product on my hair for the first time. I have shoulder length hair, slightly wavy, quite thick but very fine texture. I like to let my hair air dry because blow drying takes out the wave and the heat damages my ends. Most products that intend to add body actually do the opposite by weighing down my hair. This is finally a product that gives shine, encourages my natural wave and takes away the dry look from my ends. I love it.
  1513. I bought this after seeing so many good reviews on the oil and thought I would check it for myself. After receiving it and using it for a couple of days, I noticed the bottle was leaking and leaving a ring of oil at the bottom. I contacted Instanatural because I might have received a defective bottle and they were quick to send me a new bottle free of charge! And I also got to keep the old bottle. So I purchased a separate, nearly identical bottle to keep the argan oil in and haven't had a problem since! I opened the second bottle and noticed a bit of oil around the nozzle area and decided to switch that into a different container as well because I did not want to risk it.<br /><br />That aside, I love the product! It's very moisturizing and I use it on almost my entire body, mainly my hair, legs and feet. I add it to hair masks and body lotions for an extra touch of moisture if I feel like my skin and hair needs some extra TLC. But overall, I am extremely satisfied with my product and the amazing customer service received! Not too sure if the bottle situation only happened to me, but be careful if that happens to you!
